page.title: 09Local Place Names
page.content: Much of the area's{history}can be traced from{local place names. {Smelting Syke,Finechambers Mill}date back to leadmining days,when lead from Allendale was brought here for smelting and refining. {Mollersteads,Dye House}Mallow was grown at Mollersteads,to be used in cloth dyeing at Dye House;the cloth was stretched out in the field called Tenter Bank. {Juniper}was named after the evergreen trees still growing there. The berries were used to make gin. {Newbiggin}'a new building',is actually one of the oldest in the area,origin- ally a bastle or fortified house. {Fogget} is grass grown for winter use. {Steel}was probably named for its 'swordhead' position between Rowley Burn and Devils Water. There are 2{'Windy Hills'}in our area!
